intro: Tithymalus tommasinianus subsp. waldsteinii, commonly known as the Waldstein's tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is often found in rocky or calcareous habitats, showcasing its adaptability to specific ecological conditions.
